source.author: Conran, J.G.
source.title: Liliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conran, J.G. (1994). Liliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Nectaries pink, purple, greenish or white; plants within a population usually with at least some bisexual flowers; leaves usually less than 3 mm wide
Nectaries white or faintly purple; plants with only unisexual flowers; leaves commonly 4 mm wide or more
Nectaries 2, narrowly separated or nectary solitary, white, purple or greenish
Nectaries marginal, 2 per tepal, with a gap as wide as each nectary between them, pink
Nectaries and anthers purple, anthers rarely yellow; flowers mostly unisexual and mostly more than 2 per inflorescence
Nectaries white, anthers yellow; flowers always bisexual, single or rarely paired in inflorescence
